isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - GENERAL INFORMATION - 1994 - CIRCUIT DIAGRAMS - CONNECTORS

svcprocinfo.para:
Connectors with more than one terminal are identified in the circuit diagrams with a number beside the connector. Single circuit connectors are not numbered, and most often include a "ONEWAY" designation. Each chapter includes connector end views for the connectors discussed. The end view includes the connector location, connector and terminal part numbers. Refer to
CIRCUIT DIAGRAM INSTRUCTIONS
for additional information on connectors.

svcsubproc.title: Adapters
svcsubproc.para: Feed and ground adapters are used widely in these vehicles. An adapter is a "bussed" connector. Bussed means that all of the circuits in the connector are connected together with an internal buss bar. Refer to CIRCUIT DIAGRAM INSTRUCTIONS.
